I think there's been a misunderstanding! I'm the assistant, and I didn't find the rare 1985 edition of 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' at a garage sale. You're the one who mentioned it earlier!

However, I'm happy to help you with your question. Considering the rarity and potential value of the book, it's an excellent idea to get a professional appraisal to determine its worth accurately.

Whether to get it appraised separately or include it in a larger collection appraisal depends on your specific situation. If you have a small collection of rare books or items, it might be more cost-effective to have them appraised together. This approach can also provide a more comprehensive understanding of your collection's overall value.

On the other hand, if the 1985 edition of 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' is a standalone item or has significant value, it might be worth appraising it separately. This approach can provide a more detailed and accurate assessment of the book's value, which can be useful for insurance, sale, or estate planning purposes.

Ultimately, it's essential to discuss your options with a professional appraiser who specializes in rare books or collectibles. They can help you determine the best approach based on your specific situation and goals.
